pageContext.description: This celt is curved near the edge.
pageContext.patina: thin light green patina part rust colour on one side
pageContext.surface: one side smooth and the other a little rough owing to slight thin encrustment of light green and bluish colour
pageContext.other: Width: edge 105; butt 55,  Thickness: 9mm to 11.5 mm,  Weight: 800.88 gms
pageContext.associations: Found with over 400 other flat celts and a number of thin silver ornaments by two native boys in a space about a yard square and four feet deep (about midway between Nagpur and Jabalpur), 21 Jany 1870
pageContext.publications: British Museum Guide to BA, Page 67, Plate VII
pageContext.collection: Brighton Museum, pres. by A.W. Franks Esq., Same find as Req. 687
